Detailed Description

COM interface for STEP Variable instance or Step Node.

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT INode::AddAttribute ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[out, retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag 
)

COM method to fill out a step branch using the given spath.

Example
Assuming the current step node is the project or root node, we will define a spath to create a new machining_workingstep under the its_elements branch. 
  project->AddAttribute(bstrFormat(bstr_t(L"/main_workplan/its_elements[-1]{machining_workingstep}")));
The [-1] says to append a new step instance to the its_elements. The {machining_workingstep} part says to create the new its_elements instance as a "machining_workingstep" type class.
Parameters:
bstrPath bstring step variable path.
flag successful class derivation returns true.

HRESULT INode::CreateAttributeNode ( [in] BSTR  spath,
[in] BSTR  classname,
[out, retval] INode **  ppNode 
)

Given an SPATH describing a step attribute branch, create, set and return attribute's node.

Example
  IStepNodePtr pStepLine = pSegment->CreateAttributeNode(_bstr_t(L"parent_curve"), _bstr_t(L"line"));
Parameters:
spath bstring step variable path.
classname bstr classname to create and store into final spath variable.
ppNode pointer to pointer to store newly created step node.

HRESULT INode::DoesPathExist ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[out, retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag 
)

Determines if Step Node branch exists.

Example
Assume node is of type workpiece, then we can use the following code to determine if a bounding geometry has been defined for the workpiece. 
 if(workpiece->DoesPathExist(_bstr_t(L"its_bounding_geometry"))==VARIANT_FALSE)
      continue;
Parameters:
bstrPath bstr step variable path.
flag if successful spath nagivation returns variant_true.

HRESULT INode::GetAttribute ( [in] BSTR  attrname,
[out, retval] IAttribute **  pVal 
)

Returns the descriptor for a given attribute.

Example
The following example shows how to use spath to get the 0th element of a list attribute. 
  IStepNodePtr workpiece= project->GetAttribute(bstrFormat(_T("/its_workpieces[%d]"), 0));
Parameters:
attrname attribute name
pVal pointer to pointer to store IAttribute instance.

HRESULT INode::GetAttributeClassname ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[out, retval] BSTR *  pBstrClassname 
)

COM method to get a attribute variables instance (node) express classname.

Example
If project is the current node: 
[in] bstrPath: "/main_workplan/its_elements[0]"
[out]pBstrClassname:  "machining_workingstep"
The following example can be used to determine the boundary type for a pocketing operation, i.e., circle, rectangle, contour. 
  CString szProfileType = (LPCTSTR) pFeature->GetAttributeClassname(_bstr_t(L"feature_boundary"));
Parameters:
bstrPath bstring step variable path.
pBstrClassname bstring to store express classname.

HRESULT INode::GetAttributeList ( [out, retval] IAttributeList **  pVal  ) 

get the attributes associated with this Step Node. List can be zero length. Will create a new IAttributeList COM instance to return. 

 Example:
Parameters:
pVal pointer to attribute list pointer to store list.

HRESULT INode::GetAttributeNodeList ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[out, retval] INodeList **  pNodeList 
)

Navigates Step Node branch to return list Step Node returned as INodeList enumeration.

Example
Assume project is the current node. To get the worplan elements: 
 INodeListPtr its_elements = project->GetAttributeNodeList(_bstr_t(L"/main_workplan/its_elements"));
Parameters:
bstrPath bstr step variable path.
pNodeList pointer to node list pointer to store list.

INode::GetAttributeValue ( [in] BSTR  attrname,
[in] VARIANT  vDefault,
[out, retval] VARIANT *  pVal 
)

Given an SPATH describing a step variable branch, will return the value at the given node. End node must be Express simple types: integer, string, boolean, real, enumeration. End node given as list of simple types also allowed. Will create attribute nodes if not already defined. See SPATH for details. 

 Example:
Parameters:
attrname path describing attribute node to return. eg. for the root node, "main_workplan/its_elements[1]".
vDefault variant describing default value, if node does not exist.
pVal pointer to pointer to store variant value.

HRESULT INode::GetNodeList ( [out, retval] INodeList **  pVal  ) 

Transforms Step List node into INodeList enumeration. Will create a new IAttributeList COM instance to return.

Example
Assume current node is a polyline of point coordinates 
 INodeListPtr points = pCurve->SelectNode(_T("points"))->GetNodeList();
for(int i=0; i< points->size(); i++) 
...
Parameters:
pVal pointer to node list pointer to store list.

HRESULT INode::GetVarString ( [out, retval] BSTR *  pVal  ) 

COM method that returns Simple list variable's value as string. 

 Example:
Parameters:
[out] pVal pointer to bstring to store true if it is false otherwise.

HRESULT INode::IsKindOf ( [in] BSTR  bstrClassname,
[out, retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag 
)

COM method to determine if a given Step node instance is or is derived from the given express classname.

Example
Current node is /project/main_workplan/its_elements[0] 
[in] bstrClassname:  "machining_workingstep" [out] only true if class instance is machining_workingstep
[in] bstrClassname:  "executable"   [out] always true, as all supertypes derive from this class.
Parameters:
bstrClassname bstring express classname.
flag successful class derivation returns true.

HRESULT INode::IsListType ( [out,retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag  ) 

COM method to determine if Step Node type is list.

Parameters:
[out] flag pointer to variant bool to store true if it is false otherwise.

HRESULT INode::IsSimpleListType ( [out,retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag  ) 

COM method to determine if Step Node type is simple list type (int, real, string etc).

Parameters:
[out] pVal pointer to variant bool to store true if it is false otherwise.

HRESULT INode::IsSimpleType ( [out,retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag  ) 

COM method to determine if Step Node type is simple type. Simple StepNodeType types are: string_, integer_, real_, boolean_, number_, logical_, enumeration_.

Parameters:
[out] flag pointer to variant bool to store true if it is false otherwise.

HRESULT INode::SelectNodeList ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[out, retval] INodeList **  ppNodeList 
)

Selects a Step Node List given an SPATH describing a step variable branch, and returns a IStepNodeList enumeration. Will create attribute nodes if not already defined. See SPATH for details.

Example
Assume current node is a polyline of point coordinates 
INodeListPtr  points = pStepClass->SelectNodeList(_bstr_t(L"points"));
for(int i=0; i< points->size(); i++) 
...
Parameters:
bstrPath path describing attribute node to return. eg. for the root node, "main_workplan/its_elements[1]".
ppNodeList pointer to pointer to store node.

HRESULT INode::SetAttributeNode ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[in] INode *  pNode,
[out, retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag 
)

Given an SPATH describing a step variable branch, sets attribute's node. Returns E_INVALIDARG if spath is not a valid variable path. 

 Example:
Parameters:
bstrPath step variable path.
pNode step node to store.
flag successful store returns true.

HRESULT INode::SetAttributeString ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[in] BSTR  vStrValue,
[out, retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag 
)

Given an SPATH describing a step variable branch and string value, sets the value at a a given node. End node must be Express simple types: integer, string, boolean, real, enumeration. End node given as list will take string value list delimited by commas. Will create attribute nodes if not already defined. See SPATH for details. Returns E_INVALIDARG if spath is not a valid variable path.

Example
Example 1 assume current node is of type workpiece. It shows how to set a node value. 
workpiece->SetAttributeValue(_bstr_t(L"its_bounding_geometry/x"), _bstr_t( L"35.0"));
Example 2: shows how to set a list node value using a comma separated bstring. Assume current node is of type line. 
pStepLine->SetAttributeString(_bstr_t(L"dir/orientation/direction_ratios"), _bstr_t(L"0.0, 0.0, 1.0));
Parameters:
bstrPath path describing attribute node to return. eg. for the root node, "main_workplan/its_elements[1]".
vStrValue bstr describing value.
flag pointer to pointer to set operation success.

HRESULT INode::SetAttributeValue ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[in] VARIANT  vValue,
[out, retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  flag 
)

Given an SPATH describing a step variable branch and a variant value, sets the value at a a given node. End node must be Express simple types: integer, string, boolean, real, enumeration. End node given as list will take string value list delimited by commas (not variant array). Will create attribute nodes if not already defined. See SPATH for details.

Example
Shows how to set a node value. Assume current node is of type workpiece 
workpiece->SetAttributeValue(_bstr_t(L"its_bounding_geometry/x"), _variant_t((double) 35.0));
Parameters:
bstrPath path describing attribute node to return. eg. for the root node, "main_workplan/its_elements[1]".
vValue variant describing value.
flag pointer to pointer to set operation success.

HRESULT INode::SetVarString ( [in] BSTR  bstrVal  ) 

COM method that sets a simple STEP node variable or list using input string.

Examples
Shows the ability of all primitive nodes to be set using strings. 
    pStrStepNode->SetVarString(_bstr_t(L"0"));
    pIntStepNode->SetVarString(_bstr_t(L"0"));
    pRealStepNode->SetVarString(_bstr_t(L"0.0"));
    pSimpleListStepNode->SetVarString(_bstr_t(L"0.0, 0.0, 0.0"));
    pBoolStepNode->SetVarString(_bstr_t(L".T."));
    pEnumStepNode->SetVarString(_bstr_t(L".LEFT."));  // assuming "hand "
Parameters:
[in] bstrVal bstring containg value to store.

HRESULT INode::ToVector ( [in] BSTR  bstrPath,
[out, retval] Vector3d *  pVector 
)

Returns an vector from a step variable .

Example
Assume current node is a polyline of points, we can then set the a point coordinates. 
Vector3d v = pPoints->ToVector(_T("start_point/coordinates")
Parameters:
bstrPath bstring step variable path.
pVector pointer to vector to store values.
